meanings.definition: To grant a license to an individual or group to operate a business under a specific name or brand.
meanings.sent1: The company is francising its popular coffee shop to a new owner.
meanings.sent2: She decided to francise her bakery to reach more customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked about francising his disappearing act to other performers.
meanings.sent4: The idea of francising their successful business model spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: Francising the restaurant chain made it a household name.

meanings.definition: The act of expanding a business by granting licenses to others to operate under the same name or brand.
meanings.sent1: The francising of their clothing store led to rapid growth.
meanings.sent2: He studied the francising of fast-food chains for his business project.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch about francising a lemonade stand drew laughs from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The concept of francising a business is like planting seeds for future harvests.
meanings.sent5: The success of their francising strategy inspired other entrepreneurs.
